results.title: The Thirteenth floor
results.creator_credit: Centropolis Entertainment, Ute Emmerich, Roland Emmerich, Marco Weber and Josef Rusnak
results.brief_description: Hannon Fuller is a scientist intrigued by time-travel who designs a virtual reality program that allows the player to assume an identity in another era and experience first hand the milieu of the times. Unbeknownst to his co-worker Douglas Hall, Fuller has been using the software, downloading himself into Los Angeles 1937 - the setting of his childhood. When Fuller is brutally knifed to death one night, Hall is suspected of murder. Hall decides to travel back to 1937 to recover a message that Fuller has left for him in the system and hopefully identify the real killer. As the principal characters travel through time, they struggle to maintain their 1930s identities and face the danger of ruining their creation by exposing the game. “The Thirteenth floor” is a science fiction thriller that mimics the technical babble and mind-bending logic of “The Matrix” and “eXistenZ”, without ever really managing to achieve the accomplishments of those finer examples of the genre. The film, stylish in its recreation of the 1930s era and the computer saturated sleekness of the 90s, melds noirish aesthetics, romance, murder mystery and sci-fi adventuring.

results.title: The Thirteenth floor
results.brief_description: This film takes a humorous look at all the safety errors committed in a short time in a typical office. It is effective in pointing out the hazards which exist in offices and the accidents which workers can cause - or control.

results.title: The Third super state
results.brief_description: Looks at the growth of Japan since World War II, highlighting the motor car industry. Narrated by David Baker.

results.title: The Third stroke
results.creator_credit: Green Light Productions, Jonathan Green and Daniel Nettheim
results.brief_description: A bored, beautiful young office worker puts the timekeepers of the talking clock service to the test. In a tribute to the style and cinematography of film noir, this short film offers some comic relief and perhaps even a few explanations for those intrigued by the people behind the scenes in the customer service industry.

results.title: The Third side
results.brief_description: An archival exposition of the industrial processes undertaken by the various arms of EMI (circa 1950). Describes production methods of LP records and cathode ray tubes in some detail. Also outlines contemporaneous broadcasting technology and primitive audio tape recorders.

results.title: The Third pollution
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the principles of solid waste management and the problems of collecting and disposing of refuse, garbage and other solid wastes. Outlines various alternatives to the disposal of solid wastes, economically, while controlling air and water pollution.

results.title: The Third Planet
results.creator_credit: Barry Stoner and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Miracle Planet”.
Volume 1 of “The Miracle Planet” series which examines craters and meteorites and the clues they provide for understanding the origin of the Earth and its atmosphere. It also shows the ways meteorite impacts continue to affect the planet.

results.title: The Third person
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Dale Phillips, Tom Radford, Anne Wheeler and Wendy Hill-Tout
results.brief_description: The Third Person explores the chaos experienced by two parents following the birth of their first child. It reveals how they coped with the stress on their relationship, the changes to a lifestyle to which they had grown accustomed, and the mother’s adjustment from a job in the work force to a job at home.

results.title: The Third note
results.creator_credit: Lynne Vincent McCarthy, Priscilla Collins, Catriona McKenzie and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A blind woman and her Russian neighbour do battle with sound and music when he refuses to read a postcard for her. What starts as war ends in understanding.
Cast: Deborah Mailman, Leonid Dobrinski

Cast: Deborah Mailman, Leonid Dobrinski
